articles.title: Malinin made history with his Olympic backflip, but some say the glory was owed to a Black skater
articles.description:
It’s a move known today as “the Bonaly flip” — named for France’s Surya Bonaly. Nevertheless, it is Malinin getting showered with praise.

The post Malinin made history with his Olympic backflip, but some say the glory was owed to a Black skater appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Malinin performed the historic 'Bonaly flip' at the Olympics, gaining significant media attention.
Surya Bonaly, the original creator of the move, is often overlooked in discussions about its legacy.
This controversy highlights ongoing issues of recognition and representation in sports for Boston's diverse community.

articles.title: City’s police oversight agency is finally starting to subpoena Boston cops
articles.description:
“This is a significant record, if you will, in terms of the step forward in the execution of the duties of our agency.”

The post City’s police oversight agency is finally starting to subpoena Boston cops appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Boston's police oversight agency begins issuing subpoenas to local officers for accountability.
This marks a significant step forward in oversight since the agency's establishment.
Residents can expect increased transparency and accountability in police conduct moving forward.

articles.title: James Van Der Beek, the ‘Dawson’s Creek’ star, has died at 48
articles.description:
Van Der Beek revealed in 2024 that he was being treated for colorectal cancer.

summary: James Van Der Beek, 48, died after battling colorectal cancer since 2024.
The actor was known for his role in 'Dawson's Creek', impacting Boston's pop culture.
His passing may resonate with local fans and raise awareness about colorectal cancer.

articles.title: Third wheels are the best wheels
articles.description:
Third wheeling has long had an undeserved bad reputation.

summary: Experts argue that third wheeling fosters stronger friendships and community ties in Boston.

articles.title: After stage 3 blood cancer, Lynnfield woman will return for 7th Boston Marathon

Allison Milford is running Boston to raise money for the Boston Athletic Association.

summary: Allison Milford, a Lynnfield resident, returns for her 7th Boston Marathon.

Her story inspires local residents facing health challenges and promotes community support.

articles.title: DHS criticizes city councilor after chaotic ICE arrest in Roslindale
articles.description:
A person's vehicle was left abandoned in the middle of a Roslindale street after they were detained by ICE last week.

The post DHS criticizes city councilor after chaotic ICE arrest in Roslindale appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: ICE detained an individual in Roslindale, leaving their vehicle abandoned on the street.
DHS criticized City Councilor Matt O'Malley for his response to the incident last week.
Residents express concern over safety and community trust following the chaotic arrest.

articles.title: Nice weather kicks off the holiday weekend, but will the next storm system be a hit or miss?
articles.description:
"I believe at this point the odds do favor a miss rather than a hit."

summary: Nice weather expected to start the holiday weekend in Boston.
Meteorologists predict a storm system may miss the area, reducing potential impact.
Residents can enjoy outdoor activities without immediate weather concerns this weekend.
